thread.title: HS Roundup: O-M girls clinch and Crusaders stay perfect
thread.title_full: HS Roundup: O-M girls clinch and Crusaders stay perfect

title: HS Roundup: O-M girls clinch and Crusaders stay perfect
text:
HS Roundup: O-M girls clinch and Crusaders stay perfect Andrew Legare, alegare@stargazette.com | @SGAndrewLegare 9:33 p.m. EDT October 7, 2015 Odessa-Montour wraps up IAC South Small School title with win over Spencer-Van Etten Buy Photo Elmira Notre Dame and Newark Valley players scramble for the ball off a corner kick Wednesday night during the Crusaders' 2-0 win at Brewer Memorial Stadium. (Photo: RON LEVANDUSKI / Staff Photo) Buy Photo 30 CONNECT 6 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
April Dunn scored two goals Wednesday as the Odessa-Montour girls soccer team clinched the Interscholastic Athletic Conference South Small School championship with a 5-0 victory at Spencer-Van Etten. 
Alexis Saunders added a goal and an assist for the Indians. Sage Garrison also scored a goal for O-M, which led 3-0 at the intermission. 
Odessa-Montour (10-4) earned a berth in the overall IAC Small School championship game. O-M will play the North Division champion at noon Oct. 17 at Tompkins Cortland Community College in Dryden. 
Elmira Notre Dame 2, Newark Valley 0 : At Notre Dame, Laurel Vargas scored for the division champion Crusaders in their IAC victory against Newark Valley. 
Vargas' goal came off an assist from Emma Booth. The Crusaders (12-0) also scored on a Newark Valley own goal in taking a 1-0 halftime lead. Notre Dame had an 18-3 edge in shots and has still allowed just one goal this season. Notre Dame had clinched its fourth straight IAC South Large School title when Newark Valley lost to Waverly on Monday. The Crusaders play either Dryden or Lansing in the overall IAC Large School final at 4 p.m. Oct. 17 at Tompkins Cortland Community College. Lansing and Dryden play Monday, and a Dryden win would force a tiebreaker to decide the North champion. 
The Crusaders close the regular season at home at 6 p.m. Saturday against Troy (Pa.). 
Boys soccer 
Vestal 5, Horseheads 0 : At Horseheads, Sean Lyons scored two goals to lift Vestal to a Southern Tier Athletic Conference win over the Blue Raiders. 
John Scott, Brian Solomons and Corey Barr added a goal each for Vestal (9-4). Horseheads fell to 5-8. 
Girls swimming 
Notre Dame 90, Johnson City 63 : At Johnson City, Notre Dame finished first in every event and earned a non-league victory. 
Individual winners for Notre Dame included Frances VanderMeer in the 200-yard individual medley (2:26.38) and 100 backstroke (1:06.89), Molly Craig in the 50 freestyle (26.48) and 100 freestyle (56.48), Catherine Craig in the 100 butterfly (1:10.69) and 100 breaststroke (1:14.59), and Caroline Rogers in the 200 freestyle (2:20.57) and 500 freestyle (6:08.31). 
Cross country 
Notre Dame sweeps : Elmira Notre Dame's boys and girls teams took first Tuesday in an IAC meet at Southern Cayuga, with the Crusaders also getting first-place individual finishes in each race. 
Matt Karee won the boys race in 14 minutes, 23.7 seconds to help Notre Dame finish with 30 points. Marathon had 34 and Southern Cayuga 59. Frank Vassallo finished fifth for Notre Dame (14:33.3), Matt Connolly was eighth (14:57.4), Justin Bauco ninth (15:07.9) and Nico Tripeny 10th (15:10). 
The Crusaders' Chase Yoder won the girls race in 16:40.5. Payton Yoder was second for Notre Dame in 17:03, which had 15 points to beat out Groton. Marathon and Southern Cayuga did not have complete teams. Also for Notre Dame, Claire Kubinski took fourth (17:55.9), Clare Fontana was fifth (18:10) and Hayley Cronin seventh (19:07). 
Girls volleyball 
Horseheads 3, Ithaca 0: Karly Oliver and Megyan Merrill had eight kills apiece Tuesday night in Horseheads' 25-11, 25-20, 25-14 STAC victory at Ithaca. Paige Standish added 20 assists.
